p: In the effort to protect streams and wetlands as valued groundwater dependent ecosystems, water balance variations must be taken into consideration. On one hand, stream dilution will not be as effective; on the other hand, human and groundwater inputs would also increase the stream and wetland nitrate content (Ducharne et al. 2007). Nitrogen, as a nutrient, is highly assimilated by plants in riparian areas and pond boundaries, and such process may prevent eutrophication in environmental healthy habitats (McMahon and BÃ¶hlke 1996; Smith et al. 1999; Galloway et al. 2003; Smolders et al. 2010).
